intro: Anemonospermos leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-sepaled anemonosperma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruits are dry, dehiscent schizocarps, releasing small, wind-dispersed seeds. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in local herbal remedies.
